00002 #define _GAME_CELL_STORE_H

00004 /*
00005   Cell storage.
00006 
00007   Used to load, look up and store all references in a single cell.
00008 
00009   Depends on esm/loadcell.hpp (loading from ESM) and esm_store.hpp
00010   (looking up references.) Neither of these modules depend on us.
00011  */
00012

00022 namespace ESMS

00024   using namespace ESM;

00027   template <typename X, typename D>
00028   struct LiveCellRef
00029   {
00030     // The object that this instance is based on.
00031     const X* base;
00032 
00033     /* Information about this instance, such as 3D location and
00034        rotation and individual type-dependent data.
00035     */
00036     CellRef ref;
00037 
00039     D mData;
00040   };
00041 
00043   template <typename X, typename D>
00044   struct CellRefList
00045   {
00046     typedef LiveCellRef<X, D> LiveRef;
00047     typedef std::list<LiveRef> List;
00048     List list;
00049 
00050     // Search for the given reference in the given reclist from
00051     // ESMStore. Insert the reference into the list if a match is
00052     // found. If not, throw an exception.
00053     template <typename Y>
00054     void find(CellRef &ref, const Y& recList)
00055     {
00056       const X* obj = recList.find(ref.refID);
00057       if(obj == NULL)
00058         throw std::runtime_error("Error resolving cell reference " + ref.refID);
00059 
00060       LiveRef lr;
00061       lr.ref = ref;
00062       lr.base = obj;
00063 
00064       list.push_back(lr);
00065     }
00066 
00067     LiveRef *find (const std::string& name)
00068     {
00069         for (typename std::list<LiveRef>::iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00070         {
00071             if (iter->ref.refID==name)
00072                 return &*iter;
00073         }
00074 
00075         return 0;
00076     }
00077   };
00078 
00080   template <typename D>
00081   class CellStore
00082   {
00083   public:
00084     CellStore() : cell (0) {}
00085 
00086     const ESM::Cell *cell;
00087 
00088     // Lists for each individual object type
00089     CellRefList<Activator, D>         activators;
00090     CellRefList<Potion, D>            potions;
00091     CellRefList<Apparatus, D>         appas;
00092     CellRefList<Armor, D>             armors;
00093     CellRefList<Book, D>              books;
00094     CellRefList<Clothing, D>          clothes;
00095     CellRefList<Container, D>         containers;
00096     CellRefList<Creature, D>          creatures;
00097     CellRefList<Door, D>              doors;
00098     CellRefList<Ingredient, D>        ingreds;
00099     CellRefList<CreatureLevList, D>   creatureLists;
00100     CellRefList<ItemLevList, D>       itemLists;
00101     CellRefList<ESM::Light, D>        lights;
00102     CellRefList<Tool, D>              lockpicks;
00103     CellRefList<Miscellaneous, D>              miscItems;
00104     CellRefList<NPC, D>               npcs;
00105     CellRefList<Probe, D>             probes;
00106     CellRefList<Repair, D>            repairs;
00107     CellRefList<Static, D>            statics;
00108     CellRefList<Weapon, D>            weapons;
00109 
00112     void loadInt(const std::string &name, const ESMStore &store, ESMReader &esm)
00113     {
00114         std::cout << "loading cell '" << name << "'\n";
00115 
00116         cell = store.cells.findInt(name);
00117 
00118         if(cell == NULL)
00119             throw std::runtime_error("Cell not found - " + name);
00120 
00121         loadRefs(store, esm);
00122     }
00123 
00125     void loadExt(int X, int Y, const ESMStore &store, ESMReader &esm)
00126     {
00127         std::cout << "loading exterior cell '" << X << ", " << Y << "'\n";
00128 
00129         cell = store.cells.searchExt (X, Y);
00130 
00131         if(cell == NULL)
00132             throw std::runtime_error("Exterior cell not found");
00133 
00134         loadRefs(store, esm);
00135     }
00136 
00140     template<class Functor>
00141     bool forEach (Functor& functor)
00142     {
00143         return
00144             forEachImp (functor, activators) &&
00145             forEachImp (functor, potions) &&
00146             forEachImp (functor, appas) &&
00147             forEachImp (functor, armors) &&
00148             forEachImp (functor, books) &&
00149             forEachImp (functor, clothes) &&
00150             forEachImp (functor, containers) &&
00151             forEachImp (functor, creatures) &&
00152             forEachImp (functor, doors) &&
00153             forEachImp (functor, ingreds) &&
00154             forEachImp (functor, creatureLists) &&
00155             forEachImp (functor, itemLists) &&
00156             forEachImp (functor, lights) &&
00157             forEachImp (functor, lockpicks) &&
00158             forEachImp (functor, miscItems) &&
00159             forEachImp (functor, npcs) &&
00160             forEachImp (functor, probes) &&
00161             forEachImp (functor, repairs) &&
00162             forEachImp (functor, statics) &&
00163             forEachImp (functor, weapons);
00164     }
00165 
00166   private:
00167 
00168     template<class Functor, class List>
00169     bool forEachImp (Functor& functor, List& list)
00170     {
00171         for (typename List::List::iterator iter (list.list.begin()); iter!=list.list.end();
00172             ++iter)
00173             if (!functor (iter->ref, iter->mData))
00174                 return false;
00175 
00176         return true;
00177     }
00178 
00179     void loadRefs(const ESMStore &store, ESMReader &esm)
00180     {
00181       assert (cell);
00182 
00183       // Reopen the ESM reader and seek to the right position.
00184       cell->restore(esm);
00185 
00186       CellRef ref;
00187 
00188       // Get each reference in turn
00189       while(cell->getNextRef(esm, ref))
00190         {
00191             std::string lowerCase;
00192 
00193             std::transform (ref.refID.begin(), ref.refID.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00194                 (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00195 
00196             int rec = store.find(ref.refID);
00197 
00198             ref.refID = lowerCase;
00199 
00200           /* We can optimize this further by storing the pointer to the
00201              record itself in store.all, so that we don't need to look it
00202              up again here. However, never optimize. There are infinite
00203              opportunities to do that later.
00204            */
00205           switch(rec)
00206             {
00207             case REC_ACTI: activators.find(ref, store.activators); break;
00208             case REC_ALCH: potions.find(ref, store.potions); break;
00209             case REC_APPA: appas.find(ref, store.appas); break;
00210             case REC_ARMO: armors.find(ref, store.armors); break;
00211             case REC_BOOK: books.find(ref, store.books); break;
00212             case REC_CLOT: clothes.find(ref, store.clothes); break;
00213             case REC_CONT: containers.find(ref, store.containers); break;
00214             case REC_CREA: creatures.find(ref, store.creatures); break;
00215             case REC_DOOR: doors.find(ref, store.doors); break;
00216             case REC_INGR: ingreds.find(ref, store.ingreds); break;
00217             case REC_LEVC: creatureLists.find(ref, store.creatureLists); break;
00218             case REC_LEVI: itemLists.find(ref, store.itemLists); break;
00219             case REC_LIGH: lights.find(ref, store.lights); break;
00220             case REC_LOCK: lockpicks.find(ref, store.lockpicks); break;
00221             case REC_MISC: miscItems.find(ref, store.miscItems); break;
00222             case REC_NPC_: npcs.find(ref, store.npcs); break;
00223             case REC_PROB: probes.find(ref, store.probes); break;
00224             case REC_REPA: repairs.find(ref, store.repairs); break;
00225             case REC_STAT: statics.find(ref, store.statics); break;
00226             case REC_WEAP: weapons.find(ref, store.weapons); break;
00227 
00228             case 0: std::cout << "Cell reference " + ref.refID + " not found!\n"; break;
00229             default:
00230               std::cout << "WARNING: Ignoring reference '" << ref.refID << "' of unhandled type\n";
00231             }
00232         }
00233     }
00234 
00235   };
00236 }
